definitions.definition: A cylindrical recess , typically machined at the mouth of a hole to admit a screw (such as a cap screw ) so that the screw sits flush with a surface.
The cutter used to cut such a recess. (Also used, at less depth, for spotfacing .)

main_definition: A cylindrical recess , typically machined at the mouth of a hole to admit a screw (such as a cap screw ) so that the screw sits flush with a surface.
secondary_definitions: The cutter used to cut such a recess. (Also used, at less depth, for spotfacing .)
